properties.areaDesc: South Central Oregon Coast; Curry County Coast
properties.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued February 14 at 9:55AM PST until February 14 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford OR
properties.description:
* WHAT...Risk of dangerous sneaker waves.

* WHERE...Beaches of Douglas, Coos, and Curry counties.

* WHEN...Until 4 PM PST this afternoon.

* IMPACTS...Sneaker waves with high run-ups can knock
unsuspecting people over and drag them out to sea. Shock and
hypothermia can occur quickly in the cold Pacific waters. Logs
and other debris can be lifted and floated by these waves,
crushing or entrapping unsuspecting victims underneath. Never
turn your back to the ocean.

* View the hazard area in detail at
https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/mfr/HAZARD
properties.instruction:
A Beach Hazards Statement is issued when threats such as rip
currents...longshore currents...sneaker waves and other hazards
create life-threatening conditions in the surf zone. Caution
should be used when in or near the water. Stay off of beaches,
rocks, jetties, piers, and other waterside infrastructure.

NWSheadline: BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON
